Name: Allstate
Title: Data Scietist
Dscrb:
The world isn’t standing still, and neither is Allstate. We’re moving quickly, looking across our businesses and brands and taking bold steps to better serve customers’ evolving needs. That’s why now is an exciting time to join our team. You’ll have opportunities to take risks, challenge the status quo and shape the future for the greater good.
You’ll do all this in an environment of excellence and the highest ethical standards – a place where values such as integrity, inclusive diversity and accountability are paramount. We empower every employee to lead, drive change and give back where they work and live. Our people are our greatest strength, and we work as one team in service of our customers and communities. Plus, Allstate is changing how, when, and where we work-to lead us boldly into our future. We're empowering our employees to create better ways of working through more intentional use of communication and collaboration practices, processes and tools.
Everything we do at Allstate is driven by a shared purpose: to protect people from life’s uncertainties so they can realize their hopes and dreams. For more than 89 years we’ve thrived by staying a step ahead of whatever’s coming next – to give customers peace of mind no matter what changes they face. We acted with conviction to advocate for seat belts, air bags and graduated driving laws. We help give survivors of domestic violence a voice through financial empowerment. We’ve been an industry leader in pricing sophistication, telematics, digital photo claims and, more recently, device and identity protection. We are the Good Hands. We don’t follow the trends. We set them. Job Family Summary:

Data, Discovery, and Decision Science (D3) is the research and analytics organization at Allstate. In D3, you’ll be surrounded by 360+ tenacious and intellectually curious colleagues in an inclusive culture that encourages you to take risks, challenge the status quo and shape the future for the greater good. We are solving some of today’s most complicated analytics problems, making the lives of our Allstate colleagues easier and more productive, and driving our mission to deliver targeted insurance solutions to our customers. We are partnering to incorporate analytics into every aspect of the enterprise. We are avid about learning new ways to get the most value from our massive data resources and leading-edge technology. We are committed to building an inclusive and diverse team where everyone has an equal opportunity to succeed. We strive to hire people from different backgrounds so that we can better serve our diverse customer needs.


Traditionally, filing an insurance claim consists of a lengthy initial call, followed by a complex experience of several phone calls, emails and paperwork to indemnify the involved parties. This is a time-consuming process and not the type of experience customers have come to expect in 2022. For this reason, Allstate has launched a 3-pronged digital initiative to transform the way that claims are handled:

1. Redesign and simplify the claims process to be customer centric.
2. Provide technology solutions for asynchronous claims handling, allowing customers to interact with Allstate in the manner they prefer, at the time they prefer.
3. Identify and build data science solutions for usage in this new digital process to expedite the handling of the claim and reduce customer effort in completing the process more rapidly.

As a D3 Claims Digital Transformation Manager, you'll be responsible for the data science arm of this transformation. To support this transformation, you'll partner with Allstate teams in solving business problems using data science. You'll work closely with technology and claims to build and execute on a data science roadmap. Claims, technology and data science will work together as one team to accomplish a common goal.

You will lead a diverse team of data scientists, data engineers and business consultants to drive rapid change. In addition to traditional machine learning, your team will also have responsibility for building computer vision and natural language processing models. In the spirit of agile, you will lead the team to quickly develop analytic prototypes, test the prototypes in market, develop the prototypes into full products, deploy the products for widespread usage, and continue iterating on these products.


This job does have supervisory duties. Education and Experience:

Education and Experience
Compensation Data
The compensation range for this position is $119,700 and $180,000 per year, based on experience and qualifications.
The candidate(s) offered this position will be required to submit to a background investigation, which includes a drug screen.

Name: National Security Agency
Title: Data Scietist
Dscrb:
NSA Overview: The professionals at the National Security Agency (NSA) have one common goal: to protect our nation. The mission requires a strong offense and a steadfast defense. The offense collects, processes, and disseminates intelligence information derived from foreign signals for intelligence and counterintelligence purposes. The defense prevents adversaries from gaining access to sensitive classified national security information. At NSA, Data Science is a fundamental discipline and is present in nearly every aspect of the mission. NSA is the nation's leader in providing foreign signals intelligence while also protecting U.S. government information systems, forging the frontier of communications, and data analysis. We serve the American people by applying technical skills to meaningful work, keeping our friends and families safe for generations to come. You will make a lasting impact serving your country as a Data Scientist at the National Security Agency, using your curiosity and technical expertise to analyze large data sets to inform decision-making against foreign threats. Description of Position: Data science at NSA is a multi-disciplinary field that uses elements of mathematics, statistics, computer science, and application-specific knowledge to gather, make, and communicate principled conclusions from data. Data science is present in every aspect of the mission. NSA Data Scientists tackle challenging real-world problems leveraging big data, high-performance computing, machine learning, and a breadth of other methodologies. We are looking for critical thinkers, problem solvers, and motivated individuals who are enthusiastic about data and believe that answers to hard questions lie in the yet-to-be-told story of diverse, complicated data sets. You will employ your mathematical science, computer science, and quantitative analysis skills to develop solutions to complex data problems and take full advantage of NSA's capabilities to tackle the highest priority foreign intelligence and cybsersecurity challenges. The Data Science Development Program (DSDP) is a three-year opportunity to develop and enhance your data science skills for an NSA career. Participants experience the breadth of data science at NSA through six- to nine-month assignments in a variety of diverse organizations, and collaborate with NSA's experts in the field of data science. You will have opportunities to attend technical conferences with experts from industry and academia. You will routinely discuss and share NSA's challenges and successes at weekly technical roundtables. You will study data science and related subjects in NSA-taught classes. We foster an environment where you will develop your data science skills, allowing you to quickly contribute to NSA's highest priority mission challenges. Graduates of the DSDP may choose their first permanent assignments from any of the NSA Directorates, depending on availability.
As a Data Scientist at NSA, your responsibilities may include: - Exploratory data analysis and exploratory model-fitting to reveal data features of interest - Machine-learned predictive modeling - Collecting and combining data from multiple sources - Identifying and analyzing anomalous data (including metadata) - Applying scientific methods to data evaluation, performing statistical inference, and data mining - Developing conceptual design and models to address mission requirements - Developing qualitative and quantitative methods for characterizing datasets in various states. - Performing analytic modeling, scripting, and/or programming -Working collaboratively and iteratively throughout the data-science lifecycle - Developing analytic plans, engineer supporting algorithms, and design and implement solutions which execute analytic plans. - Designing and developing analytics and techniques for analysis - Analyzing data using mathematical and statistical methods - Evaluating, documenting, and communicating research processes, analyses, and results to customers, peers, and leadership - Creating interpretable visualizations

Name: National Geospatial-Intelligence Agency
Title: Data Scietist
Dscrb:
Job Summary
ASSIGNMENT DESCRIPTION: Data Scientists develop and apply methods to identify, collect, process, and analyze large volumes of data to build and enhance products, processes, and systems. They conduct data mining and retrieval, and apply statistical and mathematical analyses to identify trends, solve analytical problems, optimize performance, and gather intelligence. They visualize information using a range of tools (e.g., GIS, R), develop scripts and algorithms, create explanatory and predictive models, and conduct comparative analyses to address complex problems.
Additional Job Information
ADDITIONAL INFORMATION: The National Geospatial-Intelligence Agency (NGA) serves as the world leader in providing timely, relevant, accurate and actionable geospatial intelligence (GEOINT). Data Scientists apply the application of programming, statistics and visualization to glean insights from large and disparate data sources. Data Scientists understand and utilize aspects of machine learning to solve and automate classification, regression, cluster analysis, anomaly detection, association discovery, and topic modeling tasks. Data Scientists understand and utilize solutions with predictive patterns from data into practical, intelligent applications that anyone can use. They can utilize rich toolsets to help users create, rapidly experiment, fully automate, and manage machine learning workflows to power intelligent applications. They produce intelligence using geospatial methodologies and spatio-temporal data derived from imagery, intelligence databases, and other classified and unclassified sources in support of national security. They are intelligence analysts who use their understanding of geographic information science and technology, spatial thinking, remote sensing, intelligence issues, spatial relationships and visualization techniques and the social and physical sciences to create information, characterize events, and discover relationships and trends. They produce descriptive and predictive analyses and communicate findings as written, visual, and/or oral geospatial intelligence. Other duties may include: 1. Develop and apply quantitative and qualitative analytic methods to identify, collect, process, and analyze large data sets for specified purposes. 2. Identify trends, solves analytical problems, optimizes performance, and develop results through appropriate data analysis techniques (e.g., data mining and retrieval). 3. Use applied statistics, build algorithms, and collaborating with domain experts to analyze large volumes of data to build and enhance products, processes, and systems. 4. Possess the ability to think tactically and strategically; operate in a dynamic environment; and deliver interoperable corporate solutions. 5. They will have extensive experience in building and maintaining geodatabases and integrating and managing foundation, intelligence, and multi-INT data into structured geodatabases. 6. Seek out spatial data from classified and unclassified sources and utilize existing tools or develop methods to tie spatial information to datasets where necessary. 7. Builds and maintains professional relationships with other NGA offices and external partners to collaborate on effective data management, data dissemination, and online on-demand practices. 8. Conduct data mining and retrieval and apply statistical and mathematical analysis to identify trends, solve analytic problems, optimize performance, and gather intelligence. 9. Develop scripts and algorithms (e.g. Python), create explanatory and predictive models and conduct comparative analyses to address complex military and intelligence problems. 10. Support the visualization of information using a range of tools (e.g. Tableau, R, and ESRI Arc-GIS 10.4 suite, including model builder). 11. Provide excellent customer support and interact with analytic units in a professional manner to help understand their challenges, incorporate their feedback, and provide quality solutions. Additional Application Requirement: You may be asked to complete one or more assessments in addition to the application you submit on this website as part of your application to NGA. These assessments may include but are not limited to: Online questionnaires or assessments that require you to describe your job-related knowledge, skills, abilities, or other characteristics that are aligned with the mandatory and desirable qualifications of this job posting. The information you provide in the application you submit must support the response you provide to this questionnaire. You will receive an email to describe any additional assessments required. Please monitor your emails and complete any required assessments as soon as possible. This position may be eligible for an INCENTIVE: The selected candidates may be offered an incentive as part of the offer of employment, based on budget availability. To receive the incentive, the selected candidate must sign a service agreement depending on the approved amount or duration of the incentive. If the employee leaves before the end of the service agreement, the employee may be required to repay a pro rata share amount of the incentive to the government.

We are looking for a well versed Data Scientist with a Business Analyst understanding to join our team, working directly with the CMO solving problems that help build a revenue and cost analytics platform with a significant data pipeline focus. Communicate with executives on the team to understand and define business needs, providing analytical solutions.
Communicate results to technical and non-technical audiences
Cleanse and validate data in an efficient and reusable manner, developing predictive or prescriptive models, and evaluating modeling results

Name: WALTLabs.io
Title: Data Scietist
Dscrb:
We started in 2012 as a hosting and managed services provider, until 3 years ago when we built a cloud tool we call WALT. In the beginning, WALT was just an acronym for us. It stands for Web Application Load Tester and that is all it did. However, it was the start to what is now many push button deployments for the primary cloud platforms available today. In honor of our flagship product and in an effort to capture the creativity of this creation, we adopted the name entirely!
Here at WALT, we deliver innovation through emerging technology. We take a DevOps approach to application modernization and cloud migration. As a cloud focused organization, we offer cloud migration services, G Suite implementations, enterprise class DevOps support, professional and managed services. About the role:
We are looking for a Data Scientist to analyze large amounts of raw information to find patterns that will help improve our company. We will rely on you to build data products to extract valuable business insights. In this role, you should be highly analytical with a knack for analysis, math and statistics. Critical thinking and problem-solving skills are essential for interpreting data. We also want to see a passion for machine-learning and research. Your goal will be to help our company analyze trends to make better decisions.
Data Mining, R, SQL, PythonData Mining, R, .NET, SQL, Python, Scala, Java, C++, Tableau, Hadoop

Name: Nearly Human AI
Title: ML
Dscrb:
About us
Nearly Human AI is a cutting edge technology company that specializes in cloud based machine learning and AI automation. We are currently in product development of a conversational virtual employee that will revolutionize how our clients approach their business models in clean energy, social services, law enforcement and national defense.
PLEASE NOTE: This position requires a US Government clearance. You do not have to currently hold a security clearance, but you MUST be a US Citizen, have a background free of any felonies and be willing to submit to the clearance process. H-1B or Green Card holders are not eligible for this position. If you have recent education or work history abroad on your resume, please indicate in your application that you are a US citizen to avoid having your application rejected.
Seeking a motivated, skilled data scientist to join a fast-paced team set to disrupt the AI market. Nearly Human is a startup brand that recently secured funding to launch a revolutionary virtual employee system. We will move the industry from annoying bots that are merely glorified FAQ sheets, to Nearly Human virtual employees that can automatically detect issues and opportunities as they arise. We provide intelligent, conversational help with complex problems and seamlessly assist human agents.

Name: Innovative Precision Health
Title: Data Scietist
Dscrb:
Job Responsibilities:
Project Delivery (70 - 85%)
Consult clients to define and refine business objectives towards data-driven decision problems
Research internal & external tools & methodologies to develop AIML solution concepts for client problem briefs..
Work with client & IPH team to rapidly prototype innovative AIML solutions including: data & requirements gathering, technological scoping and architecture, code implementation, insights delivery and recommendations.
Work with cross-functional client & IPH team to scale AIML solutions to production systems.

Name: Hyphen
Title: Data Scietist
Dscrb:
The Hyphen team is looking for a Senior Data Scientist to join our team.
Our Senior Data Scientist will focus on existing data compilation and analysis, across disparate data sources, while applying scientifically-valid statistical analysis. As the Data Scientist on the team, you’ll utilize your statistical background and modeling experience, as well as Python/R programming skills, to support the business’s strategic objectives.
The ideal candidate is a motivated self-starter who loves to learn, gets excited about statistics and model development, and is able to leverage their programming experience to build the models they want. If this describes you, please keep reading!
POSITION OVERVIEW:
Reporting to the Chief Revenue Officer, your core responsibilities as our Senior Data Scientist will include:

Name: Emerald Resource Group
Title: Data Scietist
Dscrb:
Position: Data Scientist - REMOTE
Machine Learning / R/ Python / Jupyter /SQL
Remote role that is Direct Hire-Salaried
Prefer Eastern Standard Time Zone
(At this time, our client cannot accommodate H1B visas or OPT).
************************************************************************************
Data Scientist Requirements:
-Programming experience in Python , R, and SQL are a must have .

Name: Confidential
Title: Data Scietist
Dscrb:
We’re looking for a Senior Data Scientist to join our growing Engineering team. Use the power of healthcare data to find insights that will demonstrate the value we are delivering to our customers, help improve patient outcomes, and expand the scope of our mission. You’ll need strong data chops, an agile mindset, and a love for adventure as you work as a key individual contributor on our growing Data Team.
What You’ll Do:
Lead efforts to evaluate impact of our programs and services and demonstrate impact to customers and through Marketing efforts.
Support projects with data insights that improve our organizational decision-making, business and program performance, and patient and pharmacists experience.
Build and maintain dashboards that enable a culture of self-service data access and literacy, manage ad hoc reporting requests, and collaborate with organizational stakeholders to execute data analytics projects and share resulting business insights.

Name: Tiro L.L.C.
Title: ML
Dscrb:
Data Scientist / ML Ops Engineer
The position
We are looking for a talented Data Scientist / ML Ops Engineer to join our client’s fast growing team in either in office or Remote. We are looking for a high caliber individual with a passion for building scalable machine learning (ML) platforms for deployment of automated ML based software solutions. In this position, you will be working with a very highly energetic team of engineers, data scientists, and developers, to develop and deploy ML solutions to solve engineering problems. The solutions will focus on improving operational efficiency and predictive maintenance using engineering and data science approaches.

The position
We are looking for a talented Data Scientist / ML Ops Engineer to join our client’s fast growing team in either in office or Remote. We are looking for a high caliber individual with a passion for building scalable machine learning (ML) platforms for deployment of automated ML based software solutions. In this position, you will be working with a very highly energetic team of engineers, data scientists, and developers, to develop and deploy ML solutions to solve engineering problems. The solutions will focus on improving operational efficiency and predictive maintenance using engineering and data science approaches.

Name: Nearly Human AI
Title: ML
Dscrb:
About us
Nearly Human AI is a cutting edge technology company that specializes in cloud based machine learning and AI automation. We are currently in product development of a conversational virtual employee that will revolutionize how our clients approach their business models in clean energy, social services, law enforcement and national defense.
PLEASE NOTE: This position requires a US Government clearance. You do not have to currently hold a security clearance, but you MUST be a US Citizen, have a background free of any felonies and be willing to submit to the clearance process. H-1B or Green Card holders are not eligible for this position. If you have recent education or work history abroad on your resume, please indicate in your application that you are a US citizen to avoid having your application rejected.

Name: PhenoVista Biosciences
Title: Data Scietist
Dscrb:
This is an exciting opportunity to join a fast-paced biotech service company located in San Diego, California to build novel drug-discovery models and image analysis techniques. In this position, you will develop data analysis pipelines and deploy machine-learning models based on imaging data while collaborating closely with scientists, research assistants and programmer/analysts. You will use a combination of licensed and home-developed software to explore and visualize cell biology, microscopy, genomics, and other data for inclusion in client-ready reports.
This position will play a key role integrating data sources from advanced microscopy systems, automated liquid handling systems, and other sources to generate reliable statistical analyses of data and clear visualizations. You will combine analytical thinking, programming skills, and organization with a production mindset to create publication-quality data visualizations and reports from lab assay data. You will take ownership of data analysis on multiple on-going projects from the raw data through reporting, working with scientists to implement changes.

Name: QBE North America
Title: Data Scietist
Dscrb:
At QBE, our purpose is to give people the confidence to achieve their ambitions inside and outside of work. From development opportunities, to flexible work options and highly competitive reward and benefits packages, we understand the importance of living our values when it comes to our people. Everything we do at QBE is underpinned by our company’s cultural elements – because we know it's not just what we do that matters, it's how we do it that makes the difference.
This opportunity is accountable for managing a team of modelling and data science partners and provide technical subject matter expertise on work products, including study design, research methodology, and deployment of statistical approaches.

Partner with analytics manager to size analytical opportunities and create delivery plans to ensure a positive commercial return against investments made while managing relationships with offshore analytics team

Name: ScienceIO
Title: Data Scietist
Dscrb:
Please apply at: https://app.dover.io/apply/scienceio/1abae491-43da-43f0-a86d-a98e93409912?rs=55634680
ScienceIO is on a mission to build a more transparent, connected, and equitable healthcare system.
As Lead Data Scientist, you’ll be a key member of our growing data science & machine learning team and work closely with the founders to build up data science culture and best practices across the organization. As data scientists ourselves, we care deeply about building infrastructure and aligning incentives to support great data science.
The role & opportunity
You will lead our initiative to build better, fairer, and more transparent machine learning models for healthcare by improving the way we understand and improve our data and models

Name: Attunely
Title: Data Scietist
Dscrb:
Attunely is looking for a Principal Data Scientist to join our highly experienced team! This role will work with our Data Science group to develop and implement individualized ML models for our customers in the financial sector. The ideal candidate is adept at developing and improving predictive models, as well as rigorously evaluating their effectiveness. They must have significant experience of working with large amounts of data from multiple sources and at translating their insights into production-level code. They must be comfortable working across teams and with a range of stakeholders. The right candidate will have a passion for economic modeling and for working with stakeholders to improve business outcomes, as well as drive for personal growth within the data science field.
Responsibilities:
Work with the Data Science team to develop machine learning models for customers.

Name: Cerebral Staffing, LLC
Title: Data Scietist
Dscrb:
Cerebral Staffing, LLC is seeking a Data Scientist to work for our direct client John Deere in Fargo ND.
Job Description:
Primary responsibility is within the Product Management department, working with a team to develop new project data management tools for development and continuous improvement projects
Skillset Requirements:
- Experience developing applications using Ignition by Inductive Automation
- Proven experience in the following programming languages: Python, SQL
- Proven experience in the following database system: MSSQL
- Proven experience working with data visualization tools such as Power BI
- Strong analytical skills relative to complex analytical problems
- Experience in working with large volumes of data
- Ability to synthesize, report, and visualize data and make observations and/or recommendations
- Demonstrated skills with data analytics and advanced data gathering Company Use
- Knowledge of data tools and data management practices
- Some experience in working with large volumes of data
- Ability to synthesize, report, and visualize data and make observations and/or recommendations
- Strong organizational and time management skills.
- Above average written documentation skills and verbal communication abilities
- High attention to detail with a high level of accuracy.

They must have significant experience of working with large amounts of data from multiple sources and at translating their insights into production-level code. They must be comfortable working across teams and with a range of stakeholders. The right candidate will have a passion for economic modeling and for working with stakeholders to improve business outcomes, as well as drive for personal growth within the data science field.
Responsibilities:
Work with the Data Science team to develop machine learning models for customers.

Name: SolluCIO Partners
Title: Data Scietist
Dscrb:
Chat, hang out, explore MILLIONS of rooms, or build something new to share with us all!
As a Product Data Scientist, you will use data to be an advocate for our players.
Your insights into what users are doing on the platform will inform the kinds of features and products we build.
You'll be equal parts investigator and storyteller, shaping experiences towards delighting players and building a sustainable business.
As we scale, our Product Data Scientists will embed within individual teams, allowing you to develop deep context and empower you to provide strategic value.
You might be helping the econ team think through how to scale the buyer and builder ecosystem, or helping the growth team think through how to give users more reason to return to the app.

The ideal candidate is adept at developing and improving predictive models, as well as rigorously evaluating their effectiveness. They must have significant experience of working with large amounts of data from multiple sources and at translating their insights into production-level code. They must be comfortable working across teams and with a range of stakeholders. The right candidate will have a passion for economic modeling and for working with stakeholders to improve business outcomes, as well as drive for personal growth within the data science field.
Responsibilities:
Work with the Data Science team to develop machine learning models for customers.
Use analytical methods to assess and improve models.

Name: Event Dynamic
Title: Data Scietist
Dscrb:
Job Description
We're looking for an entry-level Sports, Math, and CS nerd! This person should be excited to solve complex problems by applying the combination of a mathematics background with intuition and the feedback of experts in the field.
The successful Jr Data Scientist at Event Dynamic will utilize strong problem-solving skills, programming know-how, and business analytics to solve real-world dynamic pricing problems at scale. This role will be highly involved in the development of the core AI-driven pricing product and will be expected to make key business decisions on complex real-world problems. This position will interface with the subject matter experts and machine learning team to communicate business impacts of technical decisions.
Job Responsibilities

The ideal candidate is adept at developing and improving predictive models, as well as rigorously evaluating their effectiveness. They must have significant experience of working with large amounts of data from multiple sources and at translating their insights into production-level code. They must be comfortable working across teams and with a range of stakeholders. The right candidate will have a passion for economic modeling and for working with stakeholders to improve business outcomes, as well as drive for personal growth within the data science field.
Responsibilities:
Work with the Data Science team to develop machine learning models for customers.
Use analytical methods to assess and improve models.

Machine Learning / R/ Python / Jupyter /SQL
Must have experience developing Data science solutions to production within Digital Services, Products, and solutions.
Remote role that is Direct Hire-Salaried

Name: Tiro L.L.C.
Title: ML
Dscrb:
Data Scientist / ML Ops Engineer
The position
We are looking for a talented Data Scientist / ML Ops Engineer to join our client’s fast growing team in either in office or Remote. We are looking for a high caliber individual with a passion for building scalable machine learning (ML) platforms for deployment of automated ML based software solutions. In this position, you will be working with a very highly energetic team of engineers, data scientists, and developers, to develop and deploy ML solutions to solve engineering problems. The solutions will focus on improving operational efficiency and predictive maintenance using engineering and data science approaches.
Responsibilities
You will be responsible for:

Name: QBE North America
Title: Data Scietist
Dscrb:
At QBE, our purpose is to give people the confidence to achieve their ambitions inside and outside of work. From development opportunities, to flexible work options and highly competitive reward and benefits packages, we understand the importance of living our values when it comes to our people. Everything we do at QBE is underpinned by our company’s cultural elements – because we know it's not just what we do that matters, it's how we do it that makes the difference.
This opportunity is accountable for managing a team of modelling and data science partners and provide technical subject matter expertise on work products, including study design, research methodology, and deployment of statistical approaches.
Primary Responsibilities
Partner with analytics manager to size analytical opportunities and create delivery plans to ensure a positive commercial return against investments made while managing relationships with offshore analytics team

Name: Event Dynamic
Title: Data Scietist
Dscrb:
Job Description
We're looking for an entry-level Sports, Math, and CS nerd! This person should be excited to solve complex problems by applying the combination of a mathematics background with intuition and the feedback of experts in the field.
The successful Jr Data Scientist at Event Dynamic will utilize strong problem-solving skills, programming know-how, and business analytics to solve real-world dynamic pricing problems at scale. This role will be highly involved in the development of the core AI-driven pricing product and will be expected to make key business decisions on complex real-world problems. This position will interface with the subject matter experts and machine learning team to communicate business impacts of technical decisions.
Job Responsibilities
